question.text: Select the incorrect statement regarding the transport of gases in the blood.

options.text: About 97% of O<sub>2</sub> is transported by RBCs in the blood.
Carbonic anhydrase is present in very high concentration in RBC
High pCO<sub>2</sub> and low pO<sub>2</sub> in tissue help in binding of carbon dioxide
CO<sub>2</sub> is carried in haemoglobin as carboxyhemoglobin

solution.text:
Carbaminohemoglobin (or Carbaminohemoglobin, also known as carbhaemoglobin and carbohaemoglobin) is a compound of haemoglobin and carbon dioxide, and is one of the forms in which carbon dioxide exists in the blood.

Carboxyhemoglobin(COHb) is a stable complex of carbon monoxide and hemoglobin that forms in red blood cells upon contact with carbon monoxide (CO).
